title.narrative: Supporting the ASSEPB’ advocacy conference in Goma, DRC

description.narrative: The area covered by the Ecclesiastical Province of Bukavu, which includes all the dioceses of Butembo-Beni, Goma, Bukavu, Uvira, Kindu and Kasongo, is experiencing recurrent instability resulting from both internal and external factors. The socio-political and economic environment looks deteriorated and the population is almost entirely helpless. The Church cannot remain indifferent to such a situation, which leaves the majority of the population in a precarious and vulnerable situation. Through this project, the Church would like to bring the voice of the silent majority to the attention of decision-makers at various levels of responsibility in order to build a society where peace, law and justice reign; where the dignity of the human person and the common good are well preserved. The Provincial Episcopal Assembly of Bukavu (ASSEPB), through its justice and peace commissions, intends to organise a workshop in order to analyse and recommend ways of eradicating insecurity and contributing to the development of the local population living in these dioceses. This project will be held in Goma and will target 15 CDJP and ASSEPB representatives.
